column4: Hi guys I was just wondering if there is an app in the repos that can remove all packages that are left behind after removing an installed app on my system? I have tried deborphan and its gtk counterpart gtkorphan and they both list packages that I need and not just ones left behind. I have Ubuntu Tweak installed and it has a remover that works really well but I would rather have a tool meant just for doing this.Anyone know of one that
try apt-get autoremove
Open terminal, edit menu, profile preferences.
You can make it transparent , background image, whatever.
no, i need to customize it from the launcher and ONLY for that terminal, not for all my terminals in my system
sorry no idea
Unless there is a way in teh terminal to do it, there probably wont be a way for a launcher to.
that's what i thought
Why would you need such a thing anyways?
i keep getting confused between my terminals, i have one for each host and sometimes i think i'm working on one when it's the other
Might want to check out terminal profile names. Might be your answer.
where's that??
Listed in the terminal, edit menu, profile preferences.
mmm interesting. thanks
i think i found it
If you have, please share.
manually??
Yep
naaah
God forbid you have to actually think while using your PC.hehe jk'
i'm thinking like crazy, administering a pvr, apache, samba, media center, backup server is not easy. this is just to let me focus on what matters
You want to do this from a launcher?
yes, like i said, it is possible and i gfound the answer already
gnome-terminal --help-window-options you can set the title from a launcher.
